intro: Prionosciadium mexicanum, commonly known as Mexican watercress, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white or greenish flowers that appear in umbels. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found near streams or in wetlands. The leaves are edible and have a peppery, slightly spicy flavor, making it a traditional ingredient in some regional cuisines.
